lead_paragraph: SACKS--Harry P.,(1934-2016), died peacefully at home in San Francisco, CA, on June 6, 2016. Mr. Sacks was a prominent New York lawyer and for many years was the senior partner in the firm that ultimately became known as Sacks Montgomery, P.C. He graduated in 1955 from Harvard, where he was a mainstay on the university's basketball team. After serving for two years in the Navy, he attended law school at New York University, graduating in 1960. Mr. Sacks grew up in Brooklyn and Long Beach, NY. He is survived by his wife, Joan Sacks, of San Francisco, CA; a son, Robert Sacks, of Pacific Palisades, CA; two daughters, Leslie Blaustein, of New York City, and Patricia Phelan, of Tappan, NY; a stepdaughter, Samantha Burggrabe, of Oakland, CA; a sister, Beverly Green, of Sands Point, NY; nine grandchildren; and three nephews. Mr. Sacks was predeceased by an older brother, Sheldon Sacks, of Chicago, IL. Interment was private. A gathering of Mr. Sacks' friends and colleagues will take place at a future date. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in Mr. Sacks' memory to People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (www.peta.org). 1/3
